Note: Signed "W.H. Wilson." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  The text tells of the courage of Richard H. Hilton, Co. M. 118th Infantry. He received a citation of honor because he bravely cleaned out a German machine-gun nest and lost an arm doing it. Text asks "Can the cost of Victory Bonds be weighed against his bravery?" The illustration shows Richard Hilton advancing, with his rifle in one hand, pointing his hand gun in front of him as he proceeds through battlegrounds.
